ygData.subject: Re: Is it possible to set mole fractions with variables???
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Peter, For me it is also not clear what do you want to do. Do you mean to add a function to Cantera, which returns a calculated composition based on phi

Hi Peter,
For me it is also not clear what do you want to do. Do you mean t=
o 
add a function to Cantera, which returns a calculated composition 
based=
 on phi such as
string mixture_composition(const string& fuel, const string=
& 
Oxidizer, double phi) ?

It is quite easy to implement and I use this fu=
nction in my 
calculations. Than you can do something like that 

double T =
=3D 300;
double P =3D 1.0e5;
string fuel =3D "CH4:0.8,H2:0.2";
string oxidi=
zer =3D "O2:0.2,N2:0.8";
double phi =3D 1.0;
gas.set(T, P, mixture_composit=
ion(fuel, oxidizer, phi)); 

Best regards, Anatoli

--- In cantera@yahoogro=
ups.com, Dave Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>
> I don't understand what you=
 want to do - what are the data types 
of  
> things like "CH4:m ole"?  I i=
nfer that you want to give functors, 
not  
> numerical values, as input pa=
rameters. Is that what you mean? If 
so,  
> I think it is a very interesti=
ng idea and I'll have to think a bit  
> about whether that will work or no=
t!
> 
> Dave
> 
>

=
> > Dear Cantera Users:

arametrizing the

 of give the
> > composition as:
> >
> > gas.set(T =3D 900.0, P =3D 1.0e5, =
X =3D 'CH4:1,O2:2,N2:7.52')
> >

> >
> > g=
as1.set(T =3D 900.0, P =3D 1.0e5, X =3D  
> > 'CH4:mole_CH4,O2:mole_O2,N2:m=
ole_N2')
> >
> > Where mole_CH4, mole_O2 and mole_N2 are previously calcula=
ted as a
> > function of the fuel injection rate, mass air flow and equival=
ence
> > ratio. Any hint or experience on this will be much appreciated. 
T=
hank
